messages.speech: "CrossSite Request Forgery (CSRF) is a type of attack that occurs when a malicious Web site, email, blog, instant message, or program causes a users Web browser to perform an unwanted action on a trusted site for which the user is currently authenticated.The impact of a successful crosssite request forgery attack is limited to the capabilities exposed by the vulnerable application. For example, this attack could result in a transfer of funds, changing a password, or purchasing an item in the users context. In effect, CSRF attacks are used by an attacker to make a target system perform a function (funds Transfer, form submission etc.) via the targets browser without knowledge of the target user at least until the unauthorised function has been committed. ",
